=Use Cases - Metalmouth Controls=

For quality assurance, starting from the soon to be release version 1.8.0 of the metalmouth extension, all of the following basic use cases must be able to be completed without issue (on Windows and Mac) before a new version of the metalmouth extension can be considered to be acceptable for public release.   This document is incomplete and will be added to shortly, and updated over time.

----
==A1) Installation of packaged metalmouth extension==

===A1.1) Installation from Project metalmouth website===

Precondition(s):
  # Chrome browser installed.

Action(s):
  # Download / install extension from Project metalmouth website (http://code.google.com/p/metalmouth/downloads/list).

Expected outcome(s):
  # Extension is listed in chrome://extensions.
  # metalmouth icon button is added into toolbar.  The icon shows a closed mouth.

===A1.2) Installation from Chrome Web Store===

Precondition(s):
  # Chrome browser installed.

Action(s):
  # Download / install extension from Project metalmouth page on Chrome Web Store (https://chrome.google.com/webstore/detail/bmogbhmnbehfapbmjlaoflagfobahfli).

Expected outcome(s):
  # Extension is listed in chrome://extensions/.
  # metalmouth icon button is added into toolbar.  The icon shows a closed mouth.

==A2) Turning metalmouth extension on and off==

===A2.1) Just after Chrome has started===

====A2.1.1) Omnibox method - Turning On====

Precondition(s): 
  # Chrome browser installed. 
  # Chrome browser just been started - with single tab showing the home page or new tab page.
  # metalmouth extension is installed.  
  # metalmouth extension is turned off. 
  # Chrome's omnibox has focus (to be certain use shortcut to focus the omnibox. Windows / Linux: Ctrl+L or Mac: ⌘-L).

Action(s): 
  # Press the 'm' key twice.

Expected outcome(s):
  # metalmouth extension should start with the words "metalmouth extension on".
  # metalmouth extension button icon should change from having a closed mouth to an open mouth.
  # The tab is refreshed - metalmouth scripts should be injected automatically, and all items should start to be read out.

====A2.1.2) Omnibox method - Turning Off====

Precondition(s): 
  # Chrome browser installed. 
  # Chrome browser just been started - with single tab showing the home page or new tab page.
  # metalmouth extension is installed. 
  # metalmouth extension is turned on. 
  # Chrome's omnibox has focus (to be certain use shortcut to focus the omnibox. Windows / Linux: Ctrl+L or Mac: ⌘-L).

Action(s): 
  # Press the 'm' key twice.

Expected outcome(s):
  # metalmouth extension should start with the words "metalmouth extension off".
  # metalmouth extension button icon should change from having an open mouth to a closed mouth.

====A2.1.3) Metalmouth button method - Turning On====

Precondition(s): 
  # Chrome browser installed. 
  # Chrome browser just been started - with single tab showing the home page or new tab page.
  # metalmouth extension is installed.  
  # metalmouth extension is turned off. 

Action(s): 
  # Click the metalmouth icon button in the toolbar.

Expected outcome(s):
  # metalmouth extension should start with the words "metalmouth extension on".
  # metalmouth extension button icon should change from having a closed mouth to an open mouth.
  # The tab is refreshed - metalmouth scripts should be injected automatically, and all items should start to be read out.

====A2.1.4) Metalmouth button method - Turning Off====

Precondition(s): 
  # Chrome browser installed. 
  # Chrome browser just been started - with single tab showing the home page or new tab page.
  # metalmouth extension is installed.  
  # metalmouth extension is turned on. 

Action(s): 
  # Click the metalmouth icon button in the toolbar.

Expected outcome(s):
  # metalmouth extension should start with the words "metalmouth extension off".
  # metalmouth extension button icon should change from having an open mouth to a closed mouth.

==A3) Tab-level interaction==

Window shortcuts - http://www.google.com/support/chrome/bin/static.py?page=guide.cs&guide=25799&topic=28650
Mac shortcuts - http://www.google.com/support/chrome/bin/static.py?page=guide.cs&guide=25799&topic=28651&

===A3.1) Create new tab===

Precondition(s): 
  # metalmouth extension is installed.
  # metalmouth extension is on - metalmouth icon button shows an open mouth.
 
Action(s):
  # Create a new tab using Chrome shortcuts (Windows / Linux: Ctrl+T or Mac: ⌘-T).

Expected outcome(s):
  # New tab is create.
  # Focus changes to new tab.
  # metalmouth should say "Opening new tab". Re-directs to Google Accessible Search if no home page has been selected in Chrome or no newTabPage has been selected in metalmouth options.
  
===A3.2) Close current tab===

Precondition(s): 
  # metalmouth extension is installed.
  # metalmouth extension is on - metalmouth icon button shows an open mouth.
 
Action(s):
  # Close the current tab (selected) using Chrome shortcuts (Windows / Linux: Ctrl+W or Mac: ⌘-W).

Expected outcome(s):
  # Current tab is closed.
  # Focus changes to an open tab.
  # metalmouth should say "Closing tab moving focus to tab showing (url)".

===A3.3) Cycle to another open tab which has had metalmouth scripts injected===

Precondition(s): 
  # metalmouth extension is installed.
  # metalmouth extension is on - metalmouth icon button shows an open mouth.
  # two tabs exist which have metalmouth scripts injected.
  # One of these tabs is the current tab (selected).
 
Action(s):
  # Cycle from the current tab (selected) to the second tab using Chrome shortcuts (Windows / Linux: Ctrl+Tab or Mac: Ctrl-Tab).

Expected outcome(s):
  # Focus changes to another open tab.
  # metalmouth should say "Moving focus to tab showing (url)".

===A3.4) Cycle to another open tab which has not had metalmouth scripts injected===

Precondition(s): 
  # metalmouth extension is installed.
  # metalmouth extension is on - metalmouth icon button shows an open mouth.
  # Two tabs exist, only one of which has metalmouth scripts injected.
  # The tab which has metalmouth scripts injected is the current tab (selected). 
Action(s):
  # Cycle from the current tab (selected) to second tab using Chrome shortcuts (Windows / Linux: Ctrl+Tab or Mac: Ctrl-Tab).

Expected outcome(s):
  # Focus changes to another open tab.
  # metalmouth should say "Moving focus to tab showing (url)".
  # metalmouth scripts should be injected automatically, and all items should start to be read out.

===A3.5) Cycle to another open tab which is a new tab page===

Precondition(s): 
  # metalmouth extension is installed.
  # metalmouth extension is on - metalmouth icon button shows an open mouth.
  # Two tabs exist, only one of which has metalmouth scripts injected.  The other is a new tab page.
  # The tab which has metalmouth scripts injected is the current tab (selected). 
Action(s):
  # Cycle from the current tab (selected) to second tab using Chrome shortcuts (Windows / Linux: Ctrl+Tab or Mac: Ctrl-Tab).

Expected outcome(s):
  # Focus changes to another open tab.
  # metalmouth should say "Moving focus to tab showing (url)".  Should be Google Accessible Search.
  # metalmouth scripts should be injected automatically, and all items should start to be read out.

==A4) metalmouth menu bar==

===A4.1) Opening metalmouth menu bar on page load===

Precondition(s): 
  # metalmouth extension is installed.
  # metalmouth extension is on - metalmouth icon button shows an open mouth.
  # New tab has been opened.
  # metalmouth has read out page title, but not started to read all.

Action(s):
  # Press tab.

Expected outcome(s):
  # metalmouth has stopped reading all items.
  # metalmouth "Top menu" is visible.
  # metalmouth should say "Top menu entered".
  # metalmouth should say "Change location button" has focus.

===A4.2) Closing metalmouth menu bar on page load===

Precondition(s): 
  # metalmouth extension is installed.
  # metalmouth extension is on - metalmouth icon button shows an open mouth.
  # New tab has been opened.
  # metalmouth has read out page title, but not started to read all.
  # Tab has been pressed.
  # metalmouth has stopped reading all items.
  # metalmouth top menu is visible.
  # metalmouth should say "Top menu entered".
  # metalmouth should say "Change location button" has focus.

Action(s):
  # Press esc.

Expected outcome(s):
  # metalmouth "Top menu" is invisible.
  # metalmouth should say "Top menu closed".
  # metalmouth should say "Navigation mode entered".
  # normal navigation should be possible.
